title: Honoring the Freeman's Journal and Hometown Oneonta upon the occasion of receiving the Otsego County Chamber/KeyBank 11th Annual Small Business Awa
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring  the  FREEMAN'S  JOURNAL  AND HOMETOWN
ONEONTA upon the occasion of receiving the Otsego County Chamber/KeyBank
11th Annual Small Business Award

WHEREAS, It is the sense of  this  Legislative  Body  to  recognize  the
achievements  of  those  individuals  and businesses which substantially
contribute to the economic vitality of their communities and the  entire
Empire State; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to honor  the
FREEMAN'S  JOURNAL  AND  HOMETOWN ONEONTA upon the occasion of receiving
the Otsego County Chamber/KeyBank 11th Annual Small  Business  Award  on
Thursday, October 14, 2010; and
  WHEREAS, This particular award celebrates the true backbone of upstate
New York and the nation's economy; and
  WHEREAS,  Judge  William Cooper founded the FREEMAN'S JOURNAL in 1808;
it was acquired by its current owners in 2006 and is recognized  as  the
county's oldest newspaper; and
  WHEREAS,  HOMETOWN ONEONTA was established as a full-service newspaper
to Oneonta and West Oneonta residents in 2008; and
  WHEREAS, It is with great pleasure that this Legislative Body acknowl-
edges this exceptional business and its contributions to the  local  and
state  economies,  fully  confident  that  it will continue to enjoy the
sparkling successes it has experienced thus far; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
honor  the  FREEMAN'S  JOURNAL AND HOMETOWN ONEONTA upon the occasion of
receiving the Otsego County Chamber/KeyBank 11th Annual  Small  Business
Award; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to the FREEMAN'S JOURNAL AND HOMETOWN ONEONTA.
